main event: An observation of a bright object falling straight down and changing color from orange to red was reported in California, Catalina Isle in March 1955.
interesting points: The observation lasted only 2 seconds, indicating a brief but impactful event.
The object was described as very bright, changing color from orange to red as it fell straight down.
The conclusion reached was that it was a probable meteor, suggesting a prosaic explanation for the sighting.
The source of the observation is unknown, adding an element of mystery to the report.
The fact that it was classified as a ground-visual and air-visual observation implies that it was witnessed from multiple perspectives.
sighted object: bright object falling straight down and changing color
